lines.text: Money is like the sun we walk under. It can kill or it can cure.
Money, pardon the expression, is like manure. It's not worth a thing unless it's spread around, encouraging young things to grow.

Life is never quite interesting enough. You people who come to the movies know that. So I manage things a little. Nature isn't satisfactory, quite, and so it has to be corrected. So I put my hand in here and my hand in there.
Mr. Vandergelder is a substantial man they tell me, and very well-liked.
And a large circle of friends.
Oh, yes indeed. Five or six.
The very young are almost as smart as the very old, Cornelius. It's in the middle that you get in all the trouble.

[after the two clerks emerge from under a table]
Good heavens, who else is under there?
I suppose a rich man can dance just as well as a poor one.
[Stack finds a purse full of money - the one lost by Mr. Vandergelder, but Stack thinks it was lost by Cornelius]
